oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using feedback to enhance motivation and performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stup, Richard E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: practice management
motivation
employees
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Giving your team feedback on their performance is your most important job as a supervisory leader. Your team wonâ€™t know how they are doing unless you give them feedback that they can understand and use. Even worse, without good feedback, employees who are performing badly might think they are doing great, and employees who are excelling might think they are failing. In either case, feedback is powerfully connected with motivation, either to improve substandard performance or to continue improving already strong performance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 241-242
